title: Integrated Design-Based Traffic Signal Phasing Education Program

context.prior_knowledge: Introductory transportation engineering, circuit theory, object-oriented programming (OOP) fundamentals, and calculus
context.additional_context: Aims to integrate multidisciplinary knowledge required for signal control system design, emphasizing problem-solving skills through small-team projects and real-time feedback.

learning_goals: Students can explain and implement the mathematical modeling process of traffic signal phase design.
Students can collaborate on a mini-signal controller design project using circuit theory and programming to develop a functional prototype.
Students can quantitatively analyze multi-constraint conditions (e.g., time synchronization, vehicle flow optimization) in signal design and propose solutions.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
